description: Base class for all models

name: _createObserverList
deprecated: Use _createEventStream instead. This function is only used because currently all classes call it

name: _createEventStream
description: Creates an event stream (Subject/Observable) for presenters to subscribe to.

name: subscribe
description: Subscribes to the event stream.

params.name: observer
params.description: A class that will observe the event stream. Must implement onUpdated

params.name: force
params.description: Force the model to retrigger their listeners by toggling them off and on

name: unsubscribe
description: Unsubscribe from the event stream.

params.name: observer
params.description: A class that is subscribed to be unsubscribed.

name: _notifyAll
description: Notify all observers with a message.

params.name: message
params.description: A message to send to the observers.

name: _deepCopy
description: Returns a deep copy of the array by reassigning the values. This is to make sure we can clear the data.

return.description: A list to copy

name: force
description: Force a toggle of the database listeners by the children.

name: toggleListeners
description: Toggle the database listeners from on to off. Must be defined by children to take effect.

name: src/components/models/modelOld.js
ModelOld
deprecated:
Use Model.js and associated functions instead.
Base class for all models

name: _createObserverList
deprecated:
Private method to only be used by classes that extend Model.
Creates an observer list for the child that classes can subscribe to.

name: _notifyAll
deprecated:
Private method to only be used by classes that extend Model.
Notifies all subscribers/observers of the calling child. 
This function forces the presenter to fetch any data from the model itself.

name: _notify
deprecated:
Private method to only be used by classes that extend Model.
Notifies a specific subscriber/observer of the calling child.

params.name: observer
params.description: An observer to send a message to

params.name: message
params.description: A message to send to the observer

return.description: true: if the observer exists, a message will be sent; false: if the observer does not exist, no message sent

name: subscribe
deprecated: Adds (subscribes) an observer to the calling child/subject to the subscription list.

params.name: observer
params.description: An observing class

name: unsubscribe
deprecated: Removes (unsubscribes) an observer from the calling child/subject's subscription list.

params.name: observer
params.description: An observing class

name: exists
deprecated: Checks if an observer exists in the observer list.

params.name: objectClass
params.description: A class

return.description: true: if the class is an observer; false: if the class is not an observer

content:
Pedal Patrol

Crowdsourcing the retrieval of stolen bikes.

Development of the PedalPatrol iOS and Android application. ## Table of Contents 1. [Installation](#installation) 2. [Setup](#setup)
3. [Running](#running)
3.1 [Android](#android)
3.2 [iOS](#ios)
4. [Tests](#tests) ## Installation 1. Clone the github repository. ``` git clone https://github.com/PedalPatrol/PedalPatrol.git ``` 2. Move into the Pedal Patrol directory with the package.json file. ``` cd PedalPatrol/PedalPatrol ``` 3. Install the dependencies. ``` npm install ``` 4. Run the setup script to setup any dependencies properly. ``` npm run setup ``` ## Setup 1. Add your Google Maps API key to PedalPatrol/android/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml to the meta-data for key "com.google.android.geo.API_KEY" ``` ... ``` 2. Obtain the config details for your Firebase project from https://console.firebase.google.com and include them in the databaseConfig object in PedalPatrol/src/config/config.json 3. In the iOS app on Firebase, download the GoogleServices-Info.plist and store it in PedalPatrol/ios. Add the file to the ios project if it is not already included by right clicking on the project name and clicking "Add Files to PedalPatrol". 4. To setup for iOS run the following command: ``` npm run setup:ios ``` ## Running ### Android #### Emulator 1. Start an emulator either from the command line or from Android Studio. MacOS ``` ~/Library/Android/sdk/emulator/emulator -avd EMULATOR_NAME ``` Windows ``` C:/Documents/user/Library/Android/sdk/emulator/emulator -avd EMULATOR_NAME ``` 2. Building and Running - For more information on debugging see: https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/debugging 2.1 Debugging and output on command line - The app can be debugged from the command line by running the following command: ``` react-native log-android ``` 2.2 Debugging and output in browser - The app can be debugged from Google Chrome or another browser by running the following command: ``` react-native run-android ``` #### Physical Device 1. Follow the steps [here](https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/running-on-device) to setup running on a physical device. 2. Run any of the above commands to run on android. ### iOS #### Emulator 1. Building and Running - Run the following command to debug on an emulator: ``` react-native run-ios ``` Note 1: Only MacOS computers with Xcodebuild tools and Xcode can build and run the iOS app. Note 2: react-native log-ios does not currently work on the version of react-native that is used in PedalPatrol. Note 3: The default ios emulator device is an iPhone X. The emulator used can be changed using the following command (example using iPhone 8): ``` react-native run-ios --simulator="iPhone 8" ``` #### Physical Device 1. Follow the steps [here](https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/running-on-device) to setup running on a physical device. 2. Run the following command: ``` react-native run-ios --device ``` or ``` react-native run-ios --device "NAME_OF_CONNECTED_DEVICE" ``` ## Tests Tests are facilitated by the Jest tool and can be found in PedalPatrol/test. The folder structure of the tests is the same as in PedalPatorl/src. Tests are automatically run with the --silent flag on. To run the tests run the following command from PedalPatrol/PedalPatrol: ``` npm test ```
